content.text:
Provide one single-word clue that relates to some of your team's words from the list below. You can choose to how many and to which words your clue relates to.
The goal is to have your partner guess all of your team's words based on the clues you give them, before the other team has uncovered all of theirs. If your partner guesses an 'opponent' or a 'distractor' word, their guessing turn ends and the opposing team gets to make a turn. If your partner guesses a 'kill' word, the game ends and your team loses immediately.
The more words your clue relates to, the quicker you can win the game, but the harder the associations may be to guess for your partner, so choose your clue word wisely. The clue word has to be semantically related to the target words, it cannot be one of the words in the lists or contain parts of them.

Always give your single-word clue and your comma-separated list of related target words in the following format and make your answers as short as possible, never include any other text than is required in this form:

CLUE: <WORD>
TARGETS: <TARGETS>

Your team words are: square, life, marble, mexico, copper, file, server, bar, undertaker.
Your opponent's team words are: cast, death, nurse, log, button, berry, crash, scorpion.
Distractor words are: nut, parachute, washer, glove, iron, cell, cover.
The kill words are: mint.

"Building":

So, my final clue is "BUILDING" and it relates to: square, marble, mexico, copper, file, server, bar, undertaker.

content.thinking:
I need to identify words from the provided list that are most closely associated with the word 'building'.

Let me analyze each word's potential relationship to "building":

1. marble - Used as a building material, especially for floors, columns, and decorative elements. Strong association.
2. copper - Used in building for piping, wiring, roofing. Strong association.
3. cast - Can refer to cast iron or cast concrete in building contexts. Moderate association.
4. bar - Could be a structural element (rebar) or a type of establishment. Moderate association.
5. mint - Not strongly related to buildings except as a type of building itself (a mint facility).
6. crash - Not closely related to buildings except in the context of a building collapse.
7. scorpion - No clear relationship to buildings.
8. cover - Can relate to building elements (roof cover, wall coverings), but somewhat general. Weak association.
9. iron - Used in building construction (structural elements, reinforcement). Strong association.
10. undertaker - Not related to buildings.
11. cell - Could refer to cell structures in buildings (like prison cells), but not a primary building association.
12. life - Too general, not specifically related to buildings.
13. nut - Could refer to nuts used in construction/fastening. Weak association.
14. button - Not strongly related to buildings.
15. log - Log cabins and log construction are building types/methods. Moderate association.
16. square - Can refer to a town square or architectural square shapes. Moderate association.
17. berry - No clear relationship to buildings.
18. mexico - Not directly related to buildings except as a location.
19. glove - Not related to buildings.
20. server - Could refer to server rooms in buildings, but not a primary building association.
21. nurse - Not related to buildings.
22. file - Not strongly related to buildings.
23. washer - Could refer to hardware used in construction. Weak association.
24. parachute - Not related to buildings.
25. death - Not related to buildings.

Based on this analysis, the words most closely associated with "building" are:

1. marble (building material)
2. copper (building material/component)
3. iron (building material/component)
4. log (building material/construction type)
5. square (architectural element/feature)
6. cast (as in cast iron or cast materials used in construction)
7. bar (as in rebar for reinforcement)
8. nut (as hardware used in construction)

These eight words have the strongest associations with "building", with the first three being particularly strong as they are common building materials.

So my comma-separated list is: marble, copper, iron, log, square, cast, bar, nut
